display_name: Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index: Total (Global) Score
description:
Summary score for the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index. [Buysse et. al 1989 (PubMed ID: 2748771)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/2748771/) Seven component scores are derived, from 0 (no difficulty) to 3 (severe difficulty). The global score is the sum of the seven components (0 to 21), while higher scores indicate worse sleep quality.

External semantic reference: [CDE](https://cde.nlm.nih.gov/deView?tinyId=mJRilvX9iSA)

[Search for all PSQI variables within this dataset](https://sleepdata.org/datasets/mesa/variables?search=psqi)
calculation: psqi_c1 + psqi_c2 + psqi_c3 + psqi_c4 + psqi_c5 + psqi_c6 + psqi_c7
